course.title: Art and Mind: Buddhist Visualization
course.description: The course explores a central paradox. Meditative visualization, a key aspect of Buddhist practice, involves introspection. It does not require looking at pictures. Why, then, were pictures nevertheless made to externalize interiority in medieval China? The course looks at murals in Buddhist caves, relief sculptures on stupa-towers, woodblock prints uncovered from hidden crypts, and other artifacts related to meditative visualization. Readings include some key Buddhist sutras. Among the core issues driving the course is the current debate about the modeling of mind and intelligence and narratives of "consciousness."
